title: KATLA Ending Explained!
author: Think Story
comment:
I like how I covered LUCA a day before this 😂

Check out my other sci-fi videos here: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLY9KJ1cFVs7iajBX4Ibg6jaCAH1eIuSgd
That little boy totally freaked me out. Especially when he was eating bacon still covered in ash

The copies are not just trauma manifesting...it's desire too. I figured the copy of Gunhild was Thor's desire manifesting..I mean how could the meteor read the older Gunhild all the way in Sweden? And I also thought that Grima's husband desired his old wife back so the meteor gave him her.
If there was a copy of me, first thing we would do is to split the working week. I don't care if it's human or not, I get one free week, he also gets one, and happiness for everyone.

I love the ending where even the emerging 'Changelings' are observing social distancing guidelines as they shamble towards the town.
Really loved this series - more Netflix, MORE!
description:
In this video we take a deep dive, review, recap and explain the ending to Netflix Iceland's mystery sci-fi series KATLA.
